isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9200, 9300, 9400 Models Built After January 1, 1995 - BATTERY, CHARGING & CRANKING SYSTEMS - DESCRIPTION

svcproc.title: BATTERY POWER
svcproc.para: The vehicle batteries, connected in parallel, provide power via the positive battery cable which is connected to the cranking motor solenoid "B" terminal. Depending upon battery box location, some vehicles have two positive cables to the cranking motor.

The negative battery terminals are connected to the cranking motor ground terminal, which is connected to the frame rail. The engine and cab are also connected by ground cables to the cranking motor ground.
An optional 3+1 isolated battery system is available. Refer to POWER DISTRIBUTION AND GROUND SYSTEM section for discussion about this system.
